title: No charges filed in self-inflicted death of 3-year-old
content:
A three-year-old boy was shot and killed in his own Benton Township home early on the morning of January 21.
A forensic autopsy released Friday has determined that the cause of death was an accidental self-inflicted single gunshot wound to the head.
The Berrien County Prosecutor's Office has reviewed the investigation, and they say no criminal charges have been authorized.
The initial 911 call came in at 1:18 a.m. Wednesday. Officers arrived at the home on the 1600-block of Norton Street and located the victim, identified as three-year-old Randell Trevon Parks.
Randell was at the home with his parents, two older sisters, and his aunt.
As described in the Benton Charter Township Police Department summary, Randell went to a bedroom where his father was sleeping and located a handgun. The father, 32-year-old Randell Parks, said he didn't think his son knew where the gun was kept.
Jennifer Parks, the child's mother, was in the living room and heard a single gunshot.
911 dispatch was contacted and family members administered CPR. Randell was pronounced dead at the scene.
Two handguns were located at the residence, both legally registered to the father. The firearm involved in this incident was identified as a semi-automatic 9mm handgun.
